This is another name for the Gibeonites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Perhaps you live near us. How can we make a covenant with you?
tn.text: Joshua is emphasizing that the people of Israel have to follow the command of Yahweh above all else. AT: "If you do live near us, we cannot make a covenant with you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This is a shortened name for the Jordan River. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of the defeated Amorite king. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of the royal city of the nation of Moab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of the defeated king of Bashan. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a city known for worshiping the goddess of the same name. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This phrase means "take with you." Here the word "hand" represents the possession by the Gibeonites of the provisions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: meet them and say to them
tn.text: The word "them" refers to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: Joshua made peace with them and made a covenant with them, to let them live. The leaders of the people also made a vow to them.
tn.text: These two sentences are saying that the same thing occurred. Joshua, the leader of the nation of Israel, promised not to kill the Gibeonites. The leaders of the nation of Israel, likewise, made the same covenant. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here this refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to number three in order. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This is one of the cities of the Gibeonites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Here this phrase refers to the nation of Israel.

tn.ref: the Gibeonites became cutters of wood and drawers of water
tn.text: "the Gibeonites became woodcutters and water carriers"
Here this phrase refers to the dwelling place of Yahweh, the Tabernacle. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The words "good" and "right" mean basically the same thing. AT: "Whatever seems fair and just" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The word "them" here refers to the Gibeonites.
The phrase "this day" represents the time the writer is living. AT: "even up to now" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
